column2: Lou Malnati's came in a very close second place
column3: just behind Giordano's. The deep dish pizza here is definitely very different from the other 3 places. The slices are smaller
column4: and the crust is thinner (so take note that you should probably order more than you normally would at the other deep dish places). It also seems like
column5: instead of overwhelming you with an enormous
column7: Lou's takes a more refined approach. And boy did it work. The flavors were perfect
column8: and the butter crust was delicious (not an easy feat - most of the other butter crusts I had on this trip were thick
